name: Arberry
text: Prosperous are the believers

name: Arberry
text: who in their prayers are humble

name: Arberry
text: and from idle talk turn away

name: Arberry
text: and at almsgiving are active

name: Arberry
text: and guard their private parts

name: Arberry
text: save from their wives and what their right hands own then being not blameworthy

name: Arberry
text: (but whosoever seeks after more than that, those are the transgressors)

name: Arberry
text: and who preserve their trusts and their covenant

name: Arberry
text: and who observe their prayers.

name: Arberry
text: Those are the inheritors

name: Arberry
text: who shall inherit Paradise therein dwelling forever.

name: Arberry
text: We created man of an extraction of clay,

name: Arberry
text: then We set him, a drop, in a receptacle secure,

name: Arberry
text: then We created of the drop a clot then We created of the clot a tissue then We created of the tissue bones then We garmented the bones in flesh; thereafter We produced him as another creature. So blessed be God, the fairest of creators!

name: Arberry
text: Then after that you shall surely die,

name: Arberry
text: then on the Day of Resurrection you shall surely be raised up.

name: Arberry
text: And We created above you seven ways, and We were not heedless of creation.

name: Arberry
text: And We sent down out of heaven water in measure and lodged it in the earth; and We are able to take it away.

name: Arberry
text: Then We produced for you therewith gardens of palms and vines wherein are many fruits for you, and of them you eat,

name: Arberry
text: and a tree issuing from the Mount of Sinai that bears oil and seasoning for all to eat.

name: Arberry
text: And surely in the cattle there is a lesson for you; We give you to drink of what is in their bellies, and many uses there are in them for you, and of them you eat;

name: Arberry
text: and upon them, and on the ships, you are borne.

name: Arberry
text: And We sent Noah to his people; and he, said, 'O my people, serve God! You have no god other than He. Will you not be godfearing?"

name: Arberry
text: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, 'This is naught but a mortal like yourselves, who desires to gain superiority over you. And if God willed, He would have sent down angels. We never heard of this among, our fathers, the ancients.

name: Arberry
text: He is naught but a man bedevilled; so wait on him for a time.

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'O my Lord, help me, for that they cry me lies.'

name: Arberry
text: Then We said to him, 'Make thou the Ark under Our eyes and as We reveal, and then, when Our command comes and the Oven boils, insert in it two of every kind and thy, family -- except for him against whom the word already has been spoken; and address Me not concerning those who have done evil; they shall be drowned.

name: Arberry
text: Then, when thou art seated in the Ark and those with thee, say, "Praise belongs to God, who has delivered us from the people of the evildoers."

name: Arberry
text: And say, "'O my Lord, do Thou harbour me in a blessed harbour, for Thou art the best of harbourers."

name: Arberry
text: Surely in that are signs, and surely We put to the test.

name: Arberry
text: Thereafter, after them, We produced another generation,

name: Arberry
text: and We sent amongst them a Messenger of themselves, saying, 'Serve God! You have no god other than He. Will you not be godfearing?'

name: Arberry
text: Said the Council of the unbelievers of his people, who cried lies to the encounter of the world to come, and to whom We had given ease in the present' life, 'This is naught but a mortal like yourselves, who eats of what you eat and drinks of what you drink.

name: Arberry
text: If you obey a mortal like yourselves, then you will be losers.

name: Arberry
text: What, does he promise you that when you are dead, and become dust and bones, you shall be brought forth?

name: Arberry
text: Away, away with that you are promised!

name: Arberry
text: There is nothing but our present life; we die, and we live, and we shall not be raised up.

name: Arberry
text: He is naught but a man who has forged against God a lie, and we will not believe him.'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'O my Lord, help me, for that they cry me lies.'

name: Arberry
text: He said, 'In a little they will be remorseful.'

name: Arberry
text: And the Cry seized them justly, and We made them as scum; so away with the people of the evildoers!

name: Arberry
text: Thereafter, after them, We produced other generations;

name: Arberry
text: no nation outstrips its term, nor do they put it back.

name: Arberry
text: Then sent We Our Messengers successively; whenever its Messenger came to a nation they cried him lies, so We caused some of them to follow others, and We made them as but tales; so away with a people who do not believe!

name: Arberry
text: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a manifest authority

name: Arberry
text: unto Pharaoh and his Council; but they waxed proud, and they were a lofty people,

name: Arberry
text: and they said, 'What, shall we believe two mortals like ourselves, whose people are our servants?'

name: Arberry
text: So they cried them lies, and they were among the destroyed.

name: Arberry
text: And We gave Moses the Book, that haply they would be guided;

name: Arberry
text: and We made Mary's son, and his mother, to be a sign, and gave them refuge upon a height, where was a hollow and a spring:

name: Arberry
text: 'O Messengers, eat of the good things and do righteousness; surely I know the things you do.

name: Arberry
text: Surely this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord; so fear Me.'

name: Arberry
text: But they split in their affair between them into sects, each party rejoicing in what is with them.

name: Arberry
text: So leave thou them in their perplexity for a time.

name: Arberry
text: What, do they think that We succour them with of wealth and children,

name: Arberry
text: We vie in good works for them? Nay, but they are not aware.

name: Arberry
text: Surely those who tremble in fear of their Lord

name: Arberry
text: and those who believe in the signs of their Lord

name: Arberry
text: and those who associate naught with their Lord

name: Arberry
text: and those who give what they give, their hearts quaking that they are returning to their Lord --

name: Arberry
text: those vie in good works, outracing to them.

name: Arberry
text: We charge not any soul save to its capacity, and with Us is a Book speaking truth, and they shall not be wronged.

name: Arberry
text: Nay, but their hearts are in perplexity as to this, and they have deeds besides that that they are doing.

name: Arberry
text: Till, when We seize with the chastisement the ones of them that live at ease, behold, they groan.

name: Arberry
text: 'Groan not today; surely you shall not be helped from Us.

name: Arberry
text: My signs were recited to you, but upon your heels you withdrew,

name: Arberry
text: waxing proud against it, talking foolish talk by night.'

name: Arberry
text: Have they not pondered the saying, or came there upon them that which came not upon their fathers, the ancients?

name: Arberry
text: Or did they not recognise their Messenger and so denied him?

name: Arberry
text: Or do they say, 'He is bedevilled'? Nay, he has brought them the truth, but most of them are averse from the truth.

name: Arberry
text: Had the truth followed their caprices, the heavens and the earth and whosoever in them is had surely corrupted. Nay, We brought them their Remembrance, but from their Remembrance they turned.

name: Arberry
text: Or dost thou ask them for tribute? Yet the tribute of thy Lord is better, and He is the best of providers.

name: Arberry
text: Assuredly thou art calling them to a straight path;

name: Arberry
text: and surely they that believe not in the world to come are deviating from the path.

name: Arberry
text: Did We have mercy on them, and remove the affliction that is upon them, they would persist in their insolence wandering blindly.

name: Arberry
text: We already seized them with the chastisement, yet they abased not themselves to their Lord nor were they humble;

name: Arberry
text: until, when We open against them a door of terrible chastisement, lo, they are sore confounded at it.

name: Arberry
text: It is He who produced for you hearing, and eyes, and hearts; little thanks you show.

name: Arberry
text: It is He who scattered you in the earth, and to Him you shall be mustered.

name: Arberry
text: It is He who gives life, and makes to die, and to Him belongs the alternation of night and day; what, will you not understand?

name: Arberry
text: Nay, but they said the like of what the ancients said.

name: Arberry
text: They said, 'What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we be indeed raised up?

name: Arberry
text: We and our fathers have been promised this before; this is naught but the fairy-tales of the ancients.'

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'Whose is the earth, and whoso is in it, if you have knowledge?'

name: Arberry
text: They will say, God's.' Say: 'Will you not then remember?'

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the mighty Throne?'

name: Arberry
text: They will say, 'God's.' Say: 'Will you not then be godfearing?'

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'In whose hand is the dominion of everything, protecting and Himself unprotected, if you have knowledge?'

name: Arberry
text: They will say, 'God's.' Say: 'How then are you bewitched?

name: Arberry
text: Nay, but We brought them the truth and they are truly liars.

name: Arberry
text: God has not taken to Himself any son, nor is there any god with Him; for then each god would have taken off that he created and some of them would have risen up over others; glory to be God, beyond that they describe,

name: Arberry
text: who has knowledge of the Unseen and the Visible; high exalted be He, above that they associate!

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'O my Lord, if Thou shouldst show me that they are promised,

name: Arberry
text: O my Lord, put me not among the people of the evildoers.'

name: Arberry
text: Assuredly, We are able to show thee that We promise them.

name: Arberry
text: Repel thou the evil with that which is fairer. We Ourselves know very well that they describe.

name: Arberry
text: And say: 'O my Lord, I take refuge in Thee from the evil suggestions of the Satans,

name: Arberry
text: and I take refuge in Thee, O my Lord, lest they attend me.'

name: Arberry
text: Till, when death comes to one of them, he says, 'My Lord, return me;

name: Arberry
text: haply I shall do righteousness in that I forsook.' Nay, it is but a word he speaks; and there; behind them, is a barrier until the day that they shall be raised up.

name: Arberry
text: For when the Trumpet is blown, that day there shall be no kinship any more between them, neither will they question one another.

name: Arberry
text: Then he whose scales are heavy -- they are the prosperers,

name: Arberry
text: and he whose scales are light -- they have lost their souls in Gehenna dwelling forever,

name: Arberry
text: the Fire smiting their faces the while they glower there.

name: Arberry
text: 'What, were My signs not recited to you, and you cried them lies?'

name: Arberry
text: They shall say, 'Our Lord, our adversity prevailed over us; we were an erring people.

name: Arberry
text: Our Lord, bring us forth out of it! Then, if we revert, we shall be evildoers indeed.'

name: Arberry
text: 'Slink you into it,' He shall say, 'and do not speak to Me.

name: Arberry
text: There is a party of My servants who said, "Our Lord, we believe; therefore forgive us, and have mercy on us, for Thou art the best of the merciful."

name: Arberry
text: But you took them for a laughing-stock, till they made you forget My remembrance, mocking at them.

name: Arberry
text: Now today I have recompensed them for their patient endurance; they are the triumphant.'

name: Arberry
text: He shall say, 'How long have you tarried in the earth, by number of years?'

name: Arberry
text: They shall say, 'We have tarried a day, or part of a day; ask the numberers!'

name: Arberry
text: He shall say, 'You have tarried but a little, did you know.

name: Arberry
text: What, did you think that We created you only for sport, and that you would not be returned to Us?'

name: Arberry
text: Then high exalted be God, the King, the True! There is no god but He? the Lord of the noble Throne.

name: Arberry
text: And whosoever calls upon another god with God, whereof he has no proof, his reckoning is with his Lord; surely the unbelievers shall not prosper.

name: Arberry
text: And say: 'My Lord, forgive and have mercy, for Thou art the best of the merciful.'
